name: Vermillion Restaurant and Watering Hole
address: 115 Paredes Line Rd, Brownsville, TX 78521, USA

reviews.text: Be sure you stop here.  Great local dishes and traditional favorites   Wide choice of food items, including one-of-a-kind desserts!  Always busy, as food is wonderful, and PLENTY of parking.  Fun bar area separate from dining ...catch the current games. Staff is friendly and feel like family.
Great food, great service, and great atmosphere. A classic for visiting Brownsville. Amazing value lunch specials as well.

UPDATE...had dinner there tonight and yeah, still amazing. One of Brownsvilles most comfortable and flavorful places to eat. The vibe is always nice and the food is absolutely delicious.  Been coming here since I was a teenager and I have never, ever had a bad experience. 100 stars to this place if I could.
First time hear everything superb

Our experience was disappointing. The waitress was rude and made us feel like we were being rushed out. On top of that, the food was excessively greasy. My chips had a puddle of grease at the bottom, and the shrimp was the same way. Definitely not worth it.
I ate too much, real good food and the beer was nice and cold
All the food is good but you must try the ceviche.
Best nachos in the world. There may be equivalent but not better. Been the same all my years eating there. Great locals spot.
Fajita nachos deluxe and ceviche!
Food is always delicious üòã. Service was a little off today. Had to ask for our drinks 3 times. Atmosphere is always so lively.
Still family-owned and still excellent food.  You've GOT TO try this place!! Yum Yum Yum!!

All my life living in Brownsville (34 years) and this is my first time here!
Flavorful fajita, soft and good portion on my Tampique√±a plate‚Ä¶all the were good. Only thing is the tortillas, if you don‚Äôt eat the tortilla fast, it gets hard quick. (Maybe just mine that day) I didn‚Äôt mind at all I just left it.
My husband got the Nachos, he enjoyed his meal as well.
Excellent service, excellent authentic food. Definitely will be back! Our server has been there 35 years & she is the best!
Local favorite and a go-to for a solid meal. The fajita nachos are a step up from others and they have a pretty decent burger.
Delicioso....is all  great
Great place to have dinner. Had a great time with the family.
Food was great and the service as well!!!! Vermillion never disappoints!
This place was recommended by a colleague. We can‚Äôt wait to go back to Brownsville to try more of their menu!

Food is as good as I remember back in the day. For those of you that have never been, would recommend the Fajitas Nachos, Burgers, and the Ceviche! They also have a new item called rib eye tacos and they definitely are worth trying!
Great food! They don't have a full bar but everything is yummy. The nachos are a must!!!
The chicken nachos were awesome!
I've only been here twice now and I've had nothing but good food service and super friendly people highly recommend this place
Awesome

Food was mediocre at best, prices seemed okay until you realize the fajitas don‚Äôt come with anything. You get 1 tortilla and then they charge you $1.29 for another. Gauc, SC, cheese, and pico are extra. No chips and salsa. My friend got a salad and it came out more than 30 minutes after everyone else‚Äôs food. Guess they have to grow the lettuce. On top of that guacamole was tasteless, had to add salt and lime myself, fajitas were very chewy. Overall extremely dissatisfied. Heard great things about the place and wanted to give a try while I was in area. I do not recommend.
Great service

Born and raised in Brownsville and Vermillion was my family‚Äôs favorite Mexican food restaurant. Now I take my family there when visiting. Absolutely great food, good atmosphere, and wonderful service. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever been to Vermilion and the owner or manager didn‚Äôt stop by our table to say hi, to confirm the food was up to their standards, and to ask whether our server was being attentive and helpful. I also don‚Äôt ever remember being disappointed with their food
Great spot, fajita nachos and onion rings were recommended to us we also got a side of charro beans. Everything was so good! Would definitely come again

I was born and raised in Brownsville in the early 80's, and the Vermillion was one of our family's favorite dining spots. I'd usually get a 'girl cheese sandwich' (which I later discovered is grilled cheese). I haven't been there since sometime in the 90's. It's always held a special place in my heart and memories. Walking in there recently, I was taken away by nostalgia. Before going in, I hoped my experience wouldn't taint those memories. Let me just say, I was incredibly impressed. This crew knows what they're doing! The food was exceptional, authentic, and very fresh. Our group of three shared the chips and salsa (easily the best you'll find), ribeye tacos (probably the best tacos ever!!), chicken enchiladas, and a carb-friendly burger. I mean to tell you, everything down to the beans and rice is absolutely spot on. I was so proud to introduce my wife to this restaurant after all these years. If I could rate it 10 stars, I would! Great job everyone!!

7‚Ä¢27‚Ä¢25 It's good hadn't been here in quite some time but felt like the their traditional fajita nachos deluxe the half order very well served bit pricey for beans and cheese yet good. The enchilada plate was good to they do not do the sauce homemade just FYI it is like chilie sauce for hotdogs so kinda give n take so you get the idea. Like I said food is good but over priced, only because this place been here forever way to over rated for the main course is just a bit yet you will be served rice and beans galore..

When we first walked in- it was very busy. Wait time wasn't long at all. We got seated, and the wait staff all helped take our drink and food orders. Food came out in a timely fashion, and was what you'd expect for the country food we ordered- filling, and delicious. Price was very reasonable as well. Definitely will be back
Great service

I can not begin to describe how amazing the service and food are. We went last night for dinner and enjoyed it so much we decided to go for lunch today and it was somehow better. Being from Houston, nothing compares to this establishment for the price point. NOTHING.
Not sure how this place has such great reviews. Very mediocre overall and tastes like hospital food. We didn‚Äôt eat our meals and they didn‚Äôt question it
Try the tacos de pescado and the tampique√±a delicious
Love this place. Always try to stop by when I'm in town
I love Eros.
It was good the food was good the service was fast overall aight

The tostadas are fresh and their Avocado for the nachos is so good even their corn tortillas! The charro beans hit the spot! The ONLY thing I was not to crazy about was the cheese, im picky and I can tell it wasnt the shredded kind it was like the american cheese slices I want ti say. For sure going back!! It's a bit small on the inside but I can see why it's always packed now also their restrooms are really clean! They also have a another parking light behind the place it was a little close if it gets packed!
very average fair, undrinkable water
Loved the nachos
Service was great, staff was super welcoming and friendly. The history behind this place was awesome to learn about. As far as the food, it was just ok.

A big shot out to this place. One of my favorite places for years. Last night I had the pleasure to celebrate my wife‚Äôs graduation it was the bomb. Itzel took care of us and the staff were perfect. I appreciate it everything came out super beautiful. We enjoyed it with out family and friends‚Ä¶. Thank you Ale

If I could give this 0 stars I would. I paid $20.33 for this meal ‚Äúfajita DELUXE nachos‚Äù. As you can see, there‚Äôs nothing DELUXE about these nachos. AND THEN, I was charged $4.99 for a small side of some old funky smelling guacamole!!! What a HUGE disappointment for over priced nachos!

The food and atmosphere were great. We also had an amazing server who took our order right away. I ordered the Pancho Villa plate which came with two enchiladas, two beef tacos and a side of rice and beans and it came out piping hot and was delicious. This spot is a favorite whenever I go down to Brownsville for business trips. Highly recommend this place.

Great food and for the price, it is awesome.

Definitely recommended.  Friendly staff as well
The food, staff, and atmosphere are always great here. The fajita nachos are my go to!

I love the fajita nachos from here there like no other if you have never tried them you definitely should I never ordered curbside from them  I always dine in food is always great and they are really friendly and attentive it's such a great place this last time I decided to get curbside and order the fajita nachos and it didn't disappoint it was so delicious

Had the most delicious chicken enchiladas here. The order came with three, and each had plenty of white meat chicken. I liked their thick fried tortillas and that they lined the plate with them so you can scoop up the sauce. So good! I can see why this place has been in business for 90 years!

Visted on Saturday March 16th for lunch, party of 3. The food smelled delicious so imagine my disappointment when I see a long strand of hair as I'm about to take my first bite. I quietly sent my food back with the server. I was taken back by the manager on duty for two reasons. They were apologetic and offered a free desert, however she seemed offended that I decided not to order anything else from the kitchen. Obviously the kitchen staff's hygiene weren't on point, why would I order something else? After I explained my reasons for not wanting to order anything else she proceeded to hug me without having asked. It's 2024, it's not ok to touch someone you don't know. Please respect other people's boundaries, perhaps ask if it's ok to give a hug. Server was nice, the restaurants bathroom was clean. Not coming back though, I'll go somewhere that doesn't serve hair, thanks!

I went to Brownsville to visit my sister and I took her to Vermilion for lunch. I will speak for what I ate only. I ordered the lunch special which was chicken fried steak with fries and vegetables. I have eaten there many times, especially in the sixties. My plate arrived and looked very good I started by eating the steak first. The meat was rather thick for that type of fried steak. I didn't enjoy the steak at all. My sister said it was because I ordered brown gravy instead of white gravy. The fries were undercooked but the vegetables were great. As a practice, I never send food back I just tolerate it till I give up. This won't stop me from trying it again as this was our hangout from high school. I usually order beer with my food but this time I asked for a glass of water. Well, I feel sorry for people in Brownsville if that is what the city offers you to drink. Brings back a lot of memories going there. The people working in there were very friendly and it was very clean in the restaurant üëå.

Update 5/15/24: Stopped by for lunch with my mother, everything was delicious! I ordered ceviche and it was great! New pictures added. Sophia was our waitress, she was attentive and kind.
______________________________________
Known for their fajita pancho deluxe plate, which is delicious and consists of tortilla chips, beans, melted cheese, and fajita! I order mine with a side of guacamole. I love ordering coke zeros here, they are always extra carbonated. Excellent michelada on my latest visit üòãüòãüòã

Mexican food done right!

Quick take:

Fresh food, balanced flavors, and friendly staff. Cozy, but not claustrophobia-inducing.

Recommend:

Fantastico Fajitas Plate

Vermillion is a Brownsville staple, and has been in business since 1934. I love how they have photos hanging above the bar that showcase the restaurant's growth and development over the years.

Parking can get tight during busy hours.

The waiter was attentive, friendly, and very helpful.  Our drinks were kept full.  My fajita steak was very tender and tasty.  The menu had a lot to offer.  There was easy access to parking lot from freeway outer road and lots both in front and behind the building.  There is a bicycle path alongside the west side of the building that goes from Palo Alto Battle Field to Downtown Brownsville so this is an easy stop while out riding.  There is also bicycle parking by the front door

Very good dinner for two of us last night. Chips and salsa were excellent- fresh made chips and a warm salsa that was delicious and spicy. Our meals were very good, too. I had the Surf & Turf fajitas. Both the steak and shrimp were ample and tasty. Service was good. Would easily return here if back in Brownsville. Great decision.
The nachos were good the rest was average and the beans were oily. Friendly and prompt service.

We had a very sweet waitress super personality. SOPHIE Our waitress was
Beautiful inside and out. Very professional took our order gave good advice what to order.  The fajitas are the best in the Rio GrandeValley.

The Charro Beans were great, and the tea was good. Nice building, and lots of parking in different places. The tacos were disappointing. The music was too loud. The service was slow. It didn't live up to what the other reviews said about it.

Been coming here since 1977.   My fave has always been the shrimp plate... simply outstanding.  I had mine with an ice cold Dos XX from the draft.  As a bonus,  the have a Touch Tunes Juke box...just download the app,  procure the credits and play your fave music.  This place is a true Brownsville original. Came back and had to try an ice cold Blue Moon,  from the draft and their infamous,  nachos. Pro tip...get plenty of jalape√±os.  One of my guests tried the Buffalo Chicken sandwich...it was a talp order!   Give Vermillion a try!

First time I‚Äôve eaten here and greatly enjoyed the experience.  Martin, our server, was pleasant, patient,and efficient.  Other staff were also pleasant and welcoming.  My beef fajita nachos were delicious.  Note:  cocktails not available, only beer and wine.  This restaurant is a well-known eatery in Brownsville that began as a hamburger joint in 1934.

Pancho Villa plate was great.  Enchiladas, Tacos, Rice and Beans all delicious.  Nachos with Guacamole also were very good. Justin, the waiter was excellent, so polite and courteous. Will definitely return.
A family restaurant, can tell its been around a for a long while, staff are super sweet, service was great. Food is good, also took home some of their cupcakes and cakes. Delicious üòä‚Ä¶

I‚Äôve been coming here for years. Every time I stop by this restaurant, I always order their specialty fajita panchos. They have the best fajita panchos in town. Great custom services! He brought us a small bowl of soup which was super delicious! We were very pleased with our server (Eddie)!
World‚Äôs greatest onion rings !!!! Super delicious great steak great beer , super cold and great atmosphere !!!!

The atmosphere was great. We went on a Sunday for Brunch and it wasn‚Äôt super packed. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly.
We ordered the Fajita Nachos and Ceviche. Both were awesome. The fajita nachos had cheese on every nacho and plenty of steak to last the entire meal. The ceviche tasted amazing. If you love a strong lime-y flavor, this is the ceviche for you.
Additionally, the accommodations for my shellfish allergy were taken seriously, and by my lack of a reaction, their food handling is up to par. Definitely recommend visiting Vermillion ‚ù§Ô∏è
